contentrichtext.text: [[File:Kotimaisten kielten keskus.jpg|thumb|right|The main entrance to the institute in Helsinki, Vuorikatu.]] The '''Institute for the Languages of Finland''' ({{lang-fi|Kotimaisten kielten keskus}}, abbreviated ''KOTUS'', {{lang-smn|Päikkieennâm kielâi tutkâmkuávdáš}}, {{lang-se|Ruovttueatnan gielaid guovddáš}}, {{lang-rom|Finnosko tšimbengo instituutos}}, {{lang-sv|Institutet för de inhemska språken}}) is a governmental [[Linguistics|linguistic]] research institute of [[Finland]] geared at studies of [[Finnish language|Finnish]], [[Swedish language|Swedish]] (cf. [[Finland Swedish]]), the [[Sami languages]], [[Romani language]], and the [[Finnish Sign Language]]. The institute is charged with the standardization of languages used in Finland. In the Swedish language, the institute usually promotes the Swedish usage, with the key aim to prevent the Swedish spoken in Finland from straying too far from its counterpart in Sweden.<ref>[http://www.kotus.fi/index.phtml?l=en&s=205 Swedish]. Research Institute for the Languages of Finland. 12-14-2006. Retrieved 11-22-2007</ref> On the other hand, the institute is the foremost authority on Finnish [[language planning]] and its recommendations are considered to define the standard Finnish which is used in official communication. In addition to these tasks, the Institute also has an important consulting function in the shaping of Finnish language policy and in choosing [[toponyms of Finland|toponyms]]. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.kotus.fi/?l=en&s=1 www.kotus.fi] — the Institute's web site {{Swedish language}} [[Category:Finnish language]] [[Category:Language regulators]] [[Category:Swedish language]] [[Category:Linguistic research institutes]] [[Category:Organisations based in Helsinki]] [[Category:Sami in Finland]] [[Category:Sami languages]] [[Category:Romani in Finland]] [[Category:Romani language]] {{finland-stub}} {{ling-org-stub}}
